title: Kite surfer's encounter bull shark in Brighton Le Sands
text: Share this article Share He told Daily Mail Australia surfers and other beach goers weren't too concerned by the shark's presence. 'You could see it wasn't going to attack - I was near it in knee deep water. It was a little disoriented. 'It was going north along the beach for a few hundred metres at the speed of me jogging along with it. The unbelievable footage shows the unaware kite surfer coming within centimetres of the shark as he heads back to dry land The man filming could be heard warning surfers of the danger and urging them to come back to shore 'Get out! It's just here,' he yelled. 'Come in! I swear to you it's just here in the shallows' 'Then it disappeared and 30 kite surfers jumped back in the water and surfed until sunset.' The sighting comes after a strikingly similar shark was spotted in shallow waters at nearby La Perouse on Monday. The frightening scenes unfolded in 35 degrees temperatures, as crowds flocked to beaches to beat the heat. Beach-goers are being urged to stay vigilant as sharks are drawn to unmeshed swimming spots in the warmer months. The man filming was Adam Cartmer (pictured), owner of kite surfing social community group Kite Cartel Mr Cartmer said the shark swam out to sea and '30 kite surfers jumped back in the water and surfed until sunset' The sighting comes after a strikingly similar shark was spotted in shallow waters at nearby La Perouse on Monday Read more: Share or comment on this article 88
